words.explanation: Refers to 'he' or 'him', indicating the subject of the sentence, typically referring to Jesus in the context of the New Testament.
Means 'opened'. It is used here in the past tense to describe an action of opening something, in this context, the mouth.
Translates to 'the mouth'. It is the object that was opened, indicating the beginning of speaking.
Means 'taught'. It indicates the action of imparting knowledge or teaching, used here in the past tense.
Refers to 'them', indicating the recipients of the teaching. It is a plural pronoun referring to the audience or disciples.
Is a conjunction meaning 'and'. It is used to connect clauses or phrases, indicating an addition or continuation.
Means 'said'. It is used here in the past tense to indicate speaking or stating something.
